forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 57. West southwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 67, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 9 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
As the night unfolds over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a gentle coolness lingering around 57 degrees, while thick clouds drape the skyline, creating a soft veil against the glow of scattered street lamps. The west-southwest wind whispers through the streets, a herald of change, as it nudges the clouds to gradually depart by morning. 

Come Saturday, the sun rises with the promise of a mostly sunny day. Temperatures will inch up to a comfortable 67, tapering to around 65 as afternoon sets in—perfect for those seeking outdoor solace. The brisk winds will rejuvenate the spirit, ranging from playful gusts to a hearty breeze that can dance around at speeds of 21 mph and even surge to 26 mph. The morning may still cling to vestiges of fog close to the water, but as daylight washes over the city, the mist will retreat, unveiling the iconic outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge and the surrounding neighborhoods. 

For attire, consider layering—a light jacket or sweater in the morning will combat any lingering chill, while a more relaxed outfit in the afternoon will allow one to relish the warmth without overheating. This day invites urban exploration: perhaps a leisurely stroll through Golden Gate Park, where each twist and turn offers a blend of nature and culture, or a quiet moment at a café, enjoying an artisan coffee while watching the world pass by. It’s the kind of day that beckons you to embrace the city’s charm in a relaxed whisper rather than an exclamation.
